| Storage of materials procedure in place | Is a documented storage of materials and finished products procedure in place? |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |  |  |

| Procedures to maintain product safety and quality during storage shall be risk-based, understood by the relevant staff, and implemented accordingly. They shall include, as appropriate: instructions for the packing of finished product, segregation of products where necessary to avoid cross-contamination (physical, microbiological or allergenic), mixing of sorts, or taint, storage of product/materials off the floor and away from walls  ·         specific handling or stacking requirements to prevent product damage. |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |
|  | Finished or intermediate product storage shall meet customer requirements (with regard to first in, first out (FIFO), where applicable), with dispatch after positive release.  Where external storage of finished product is required, the product shall be suitably protected. |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |
| Natural work group trained | Have the relevant people been trained on this procedure? |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |
| Storage of materials and finished products | Are all materials, work in process and product, protected from contamination during storage? |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |
| How is return of packaging materials to the storeroom regulated? |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |
| Is a procedure in place for the segregation of raw materials, intermediate products and finished products to prevent contamination? |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Packaging used for storage or dispatch of intermediate or finished products, such as pallets, shall be appropriately protected if stored outside and inspected for signs of damage or contamination prior to use. |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is material intended for recycling appropriately protected against contamination hazards? |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is an 18”(46 cm) internal wall perimeter being maintained within the storage with adequate access to these wall perimeters thereby allowing inspection and cleaning? |  | 3 |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Handling of hazardous chemicals | Is there a chemical control program in place to minimize the risk of hazardous chemicals to product quality and legality? No Packaging materials are stored in an area used to store hazardous chemicals? |  | 3 |  |  | . |  |  |  |
